docket_entries.description: AGREED NOTICE of Motion by William Cory Spence for presentment of motion for extension of time to file answer, motion for relief[7] before Honorable John Robert Blakey on 8/23/2016 at 09:45 AM. (Spence, William)

MINUTE entry before the Honorable John Robert Blakey: Agreed motion for extension of time to response to Plaintiff's complaint [7] is granted, and Defendant's answer or other responsive pleading is now due 9/26/16. The 8/23/16 Notice of Motion date is stricken, and the parties need not appear. The case is set for an initial status conference on 9/29/16 at 9:45 a.m. in Courtroom 1725. The parties are advised to review and strictly comply with the Court's standing order concerning initial status conferences and the filing of the initial status report (which, in this case, will be due no later than 9/26/16). The standing order and the template for the initial status report are available on the Court's homepage at www.ilnd.uscourts.gov. By way of preliminary information, the Court expects attorneys to appear at all set dates. If an attorney has a conflict with a set date, the attorney must notify Judge Blakey's Courtroom Deputy, Gloria Lewis, at (312) 818-6699. If appropriate, the Court will then reset the matter. Advising opposing counsel of a conflict is not a substitute for communicating with the Court. Attorneys who fail to appear and fail to notify the Courtroom Deputy of any conflict may be subject to sanctions. Additionally, the parties are strongly encouraged to consider consenting to proceed before the assigned United States Magistrate Judge. Should the parties elect to do so, they should notify Mrs. Lewis, and the case will be reassigned upon receipt of the signed consent form. Mailed notice (gel, )
docket_entries.short_description: order on motion for extension of time to answer

Defendant's answer or other responsive pleading shall be filed on or before 10/17/2016. Initial status hearing previously set for 10/6/2016 is reset for 11/3/2016 at 9:00 a.m. in Courtroom 1725. Mailed notice (gel, )

docket_entries.description: NOTICE of Motion by Edward Keith Runyan for presentment of motion for leave to file excess pages[15] before Honorable John Robert Blakey on 10/13/2016 at 09:45 AM. (Runyan, Edward)

MINUTE entry before the Honorable John Robert Blakey: Defendant's motion for leave to file a brief in excess of 15 pages [15] is granted, and Defendant is given leave to file a brief of up to 20 pages, inclusive of exhibits. The 10/13/16 Notice of Motion date is stricken, and the parties need not appear. The 11/3/16 status hearing date stands. Defendant's motion indicates that it plans to file a motion to dismiss in lieu of an answer. Plaintiff is advised that the Court's standing order on Motions to Dismiss (available on the Court's homepage at www.ilnd.uscourts.gov) requires that, in the face of a motion to dismiss, a plaintiff must make an election as to whether it will amend the complaint or stand on the current complaint and proceed with briefing on the motion to dismiss. Should Defendant file its motion to dismiss in advance of the 11/3/16 status hearing, Plaintiff should be prepared to make the required election at that hearing. Mailed notice (gel, )
docket_entries.short_description: order on motion for leave to file excess pages

docket_entries.description: MOTION by Defendant Barco, Inc. to dismiss (Runyan, Edward)

NOTICE of Motion by Edward Keith Runyan for presentment of motion to dismiss[18] before Honorable John Robert Blakey on 10/27/2016 at 09:45 AM. (Runyan, Edward)

MINUTE entry before the Honorable John Robert Blakey: Defendant's motion to dismiss [18] is entered and continued to 11/3/2016 at 9:00 a.m. in Courtroom 1725. Plaintiff is advised to review the Courts standing order on Motions to Dismiss, which is available on the Courts homepage at www.ilnd.uscourts.gov. The Court's Order requires Plaintiff to make an election as to whether he/she will amend the complaint or stand on the current complaint and proceed with briefing on the motion to dismiss. Plaintiff should be prepared at that time to make the required election. Motion hearing date of 10/27/2016 is stricken. Mailed notice (gel, )
STATUS Report by T-Rex Property AB (Spence, William)
ATTORNEY Appearance for Plaintiff T-Rex Property AB by Jacob Robert Graham (Graham, Jacob)

MINUTE entry before the Honorable John Robert Blakey: Status and motion hearing held on 11/3/2016 and continued to 11/16/2016 at 10:00 a.m. in Courtroom 1725. Plaintiff should be prepared to make the required election regarding the motion to dismiss at the next hearing. Oral motion to stay discovery is denied. Mailed notice (gel, )

Parties should meet and confer and be prepared to set a discovery schedule at the next hearing. Mailed notice (gel, )

MINUTE entry before the Honorable John Robert Blakey: Motion hearing held on 9/19/2017. Defendant's motion to strike [46] is denied as moot. Any amended infringement contentions shall be filed on or before 10/10/2017. Plaintiff's motion to amend [56] is granted. Amended complaint shall be filed as a separate docket entry. Defendant's motion to strike amended complaint [30] and Defendant's motion to dismiss amended complaint [33] are taken under advisement and will be ruled on by separate order. Motion hearing set for 9/21/2017 is stricken. The Court will set additional case management dates, as needed, by separate order. Mailed notice (gel, )
